page.title: 01GAZETEER
page.content: The area consists of: part of Kidsgrove, Newchapel, Whitehill, Harriseahead,Brown Lees and Mount Pleasant.The area is generally sparsely populated , the main concentration being in Kidsgrove.Housing is predominantly post war council with integrated private holdings. Industry is mainly small scale dairy farming .Remnants of the industrial revolution are present, such as disused collieries,quarries and the Trent and Mersey Canal.Some employment is found in tertiary industry but the area is mainly a commuter zone. The area is dominated by Mow Cop, the most southerly point of the Pennine Chainn most southerly point of the Pennine Chain and can be seen from all parts.To the north west the horizon is dominated by the Cheshire Plain.
